full_summary:
# Request for Proposals (RFP) for Multi-disciplinary Architectural and Engineering Consultant Services

## Overview
Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites consulting firms to submit abbreviated proposals for the establishment of a Source List (SL) to provide professional services specific to the Department of National Defence's requirements in Manitoba, Saskatchewan, and Alberta.

## Key Details
- **Procurement**: The project follows the procurement procedures outlined in Chapter 10 of the North American Free Trade Agreement.
- **Scope of Work**: The SL will provide services for administration and service buildings, educational buildings, industrial buildings, residential buildings, warehouse buildings, and architectural services.
- **Security Requirements**: Refer to the RFP documents for security requirements.
- **Contract Details**: The SL will be valid for three years with an estimated maximum value of $12,000,000.00. Commissions under the SL are expected to be valued between $100,000.00 and $350,000.00.
- **Timeline**:
  - **Closing Date**: 20 September 2022 at 14:00 Eastern Daylight Time (EDT)
  - **Proposal Submission**: Submit through the MERX Electronic Bidding System

## Eligibility and Evaluation Criteria
Consulting firms considering themselves qualified to provide these services are invited to submit their proposals. The proposal evaluation will be based on established criteria in the Request for Proposal (RFP) documents.

## Contact Information
For any questions or concerns, please contact Steve Kennedy at:

- Email: [steve.kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca](mailto:steve.kennedy@dcc-cdc.gc.ca)
- Phone: 613-769-2659

## Additional Information
Contract award results will be available on the Defence Construction Canada website at Contract Activity - Defence Construction Canada (dcc-cdc.gc.ca) after the proposal evaluation process is complete.
